text: (whispering) Ashlee Dawn! Ashlee pounces on her brother sleeping in the chair.

Wake up! Wake up! Ashlee pounces again. Ree drops fat into a hot skillet. She cuts a potato and d the pieces into the hissing fat. The radio music becomes newscast reporting the cold weather conditions. Ashlee, wrapped in a blanket, watches Ree at the stove.
Morning.
Morning. Ree opens the fridge and pokes around for something to gi the dog. She takes out a bowl, smells what’s inside and h it to Ashlee.

Better than nothing. Ashlee heads outside to give the dog his food. EXT. REE’S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER Ashlee carries the dog’s food across the yard. NICKDOG, t family hound, greets her enthusiastically. She places the bowl on the ground. INT. REE’S HOUSE - BATHROOM - CONTINUOUS Ree combs her mother’s wet hair. A hymn plays on the radi Sonny enters, holding a dog.
Who's this?
Peanut Butter.
Where’d you find Peanut Butter?
In the woods.
He’s sweet. Ree and her mother pet the dog.
Ree, Sonny, Ashlee and two dogs are walking to school.
Spell ‘house’.
A-woo.
Uh uh.
Ssssss.
H-O-U-S-E. Seven plus two.

Nine.  Good. INT. SCHOOL, CHILDREN’S CLASSROOM - DAY Ashlee does an art project at a table with other children Ree watches her and then walks down the hallway to the hi school wing of the K-12 school.
A parenting class. The STUDENTS each hold a mechanical ba and follow the TEACHER’S instructions. Ree watches from t hallway.

Transfer. Careful. Cradle the head. And then take him to your shoulder. So he’s up a little bit higher, but you’re still supporting the head. Make sure you hold this right under... Shots of the teens in the class earnestly trying to hold their model babies correctly.
ROTC students march down hallway with rifles and turn to enter the gym. Ree approaches from the opposite direction
Could I have your attention, please? Forsyth Misouri chapter of the Family, Consumer and Career leaders of America... One of Ree’s former classmates sees her and waves.
Hey, Ree.
+. will meet this Friday at 3:00pm in Mrs. Blair’s room.
Front and Center.
From a doorway we see ROTC students drilling in the gym. Ree watches them through the window.
Truman University will be here next Monday at 8:45.
Forward, march!
If you would like to attend, please sign up in the counselor’s office.
Forward, march!
Alignment...

The Marine Corps Birthday Ball will be this Saturday evening. All ROTC cadets and their families are encouraged to attend. Ree signs up at a clipboard. EXT. BLOND MILTON’S YARD - DAY SONYA, Ree’s relative, is feeding her horses in her barn area. Sonya and her husband live across the holler from Ree’s family.
(To the horses) Alright. EXT. REE’S YARD - DAY Ree leads a horse across a wintry yard to Sonya’s barn ar  EXT. BLOND MILTON’S YARD - DAY Ree walks towards the barn.
Hi Sonya.
Hey Ree. Sonya puts down the pitchfork and faces Ree.
You and the kids alright?
We're just a little short on cash right now.
How long’s it been since the horse ate?
About four days.
That hay gets kind of expensive, don’t it?
Yes ma’am. (beat) Actually, I was wondering if you could keep her with yours? After a long pause, Sonya opens the gate to the pasture a ushers Ree’s horse in to join the others.
(to Ree’s horse) Alright, Ginger, Come on in. Come on. There you go. Have a little bit of that. Come on. Get going.
Thank you, Sonya.

Alright. Ree takes a last look at her horse and retraces her steps across the yard. EXT. REE’S YARD - DAY Ree chops wood. She’s got headphones on and the music is fueling her chopping. There is the sound of a car approaching. Nickdog barks an runs across the yard to greet the car. Ree’s relatives, Sonya and her husband, BLOND MILTON, are skinning a deer in their yard. They look up to see who’s approaching. As the car gets closer, Ree can see that it police car. She throws down her axe and approaches the ca as it pulls to a stop. SHERIFF BASKIN, 30's, gets out. Ree climbs the porch step and blocks the front door of her house. EXT. REE’S HOUSE, PORCH - DAY
How are you today? Ree doesn’t answer.
Ask me inside. I need to talk some with your mama. Ree opens the door and steps aside.
She don’t talk much. Sheriff Baskin enters the house.
Ma’am? I was wondering if I could ask you a few questions. (beat) Ma‘ am?  Ree can hear that her mother is not responding. Baskin returns to the porch.
You better just tell me. Baskin positions himself directly across from Ree and lea against the porch post.
You know your daddy’s out on bond, don’t you?
So what?
Looks like he’s been cooking again.
I know that’s the charges you laid on him, but you ain’t proved it on him. You got to prove it every time.
Well, that won’t be no hard thing to do. But that ain’t even why I’m here. His court date’s next week, and I can’t seem to turn him up.
Maybe he sees you and ducks.
That could be. But where you all come into this is, he put this house here, and your timber acres up for his bond.
He what now?
Jessup signed over everything. If he doesn’t show at trial, see, the way the deal works is, you all gonna lose this place. (MORE )
SHERIFF BASKIN (cont'd) (beat) You got some place to go? Shock courses through Ree, but she tries to mask it.
I’ll find him.
Girl, I’ve been lookin’.
I said I’1l find him. Baskin looks out across the property. He sees Blond Milto scoping him out. After a moment Baskin turns to leave.

You make sure your daddy knows the gravity of this deal. Baskin drives away. Blond Milton and Sonya resume skinnin their deer. Sonny carries split wood to the porch and stands next to watching Sonya and Blond cut down the hanging meat in the yard.
Maybe they’1ll share some of that with us.
That could be.
Maybe we should ask. Ree looks at her little brother, holding his chin in her hand.

Never ask for what oughtta be offered. INT. REE’S HOUSE - EVENING Ashlee and Sonny are warming themselves by the wood stove Sonya enters, carrying in a large cardboard box that has venison bone jutting above the rim.  11.
Evening, Ree.
Evening.
Kids. Hey, Connie. Didn’t want you to think we’d forgot y’all. Sonya sets the box on the counter.
Brought you some meat, some potatoes, and some stuff for a good stew, anyway.
Thank you. We can use it.
Seen your woodpile’s low out front. We got that splitter up there in the yard. You should use it.
I’1l do that.
We seen the law was out here this afternoon. Everything alright?
He’s hunting for Dad. Sonny, listening to the conversation, looks up.
Hunting Jessup is he? You know where he’s at?
No.
You sure about that?
Yes.  12.
Alright, alright, well I guess you didn’t have nothing to tell him, then, did you?
I wouldn't tell him nothing if I did.
Oh, we know that. I’m gonna let you get to it, alright? Sonya leaves abruptly, waving goodbye to Connie and pulli the door shut behind her. Ree looks at her brother and sister.
How about some deer stew - that sound good?
Mmm hmm.
Alright, both of you need to get over here and watch how I make it.
Ree walks along a brambly road and turns off into a drive
Ree crosses the yard and climbs a porch. She knocks on th door and stands, waiting. She can hear thrash metal music coming from inside. The door is opened by GAIL, 17, holdi her baby NED.
Thank god it’s you, Sweet Pea, and not Floyd’s mommy and daddy again. Them two watch me like I done something wrong.  13.
FLOYD, 18, is pulling on the boots to his ATV outfit.
Would you hush your mouth about them. They put a roof over your head ain’t they?
Hey, Floyd. You gonna invite me in? Or I could just stay out here and talk to you.
Yeah, you can come in. Ree steps inside the house and walks past Floyd to the kitchen. INT. GAIL’S HOUSE, KITCHEN - DAY Gail holds Ned. She hugs Ree.
Hey.
Hey. Ree takes in Ned and the fact that her best friend now ha baby. Shit.
Don’t start. Come on. Gail carries Ned down the narrow hall to the bedroom. Ree follows.
Ree flops down on the bed. Gail lies down next to her, putting Ned between them.  14.
It’s been a while, Sweet Pea.
Things stack up is all.
What’s going on?
The sheriff came by looking for my Dad. If he don’t show up for his court date, we’re gonna lose the house. Gotta get down to the Arkansas line.
I gotta ask him. It’s his truck. Gail gets up and leaves the room. Ree holds Ned while Gai talks to Floyd. Gail returns.
He said no.
Did you tell him I'd spring for gas?
I told him. He still won't.
Why not?
He never says why not to me, Ree. He just says no.
Man, that’s so sad to hear you say he won't let you do something, and then you don’t do it.
It’s different once you’re married. Gail flops back onto the bed.  15.
It really must be. Cause you ain’t never used to eat no shit.
Ned needs his nap. Gail takes Ned from Ree’s arms.
(whispers to baby) Come here. Ree leaves and Gail watches her go.
Ree treks up a wooded hill. EXT. TEARDROP’S YARD - DAY Ree enters the yard, greeted by dogs. VICTORIA, 30's, opens the door of a rough-hewn brown pain cabin.
What brings you here? Somebody dead?
I’m looking for my Dad. Victoria holds the door for Ree and beckons her inside.
Come on in. Shake off the chill. Ree enters the house, followed by Victoria. INT. TEARDROP’S HOUSE, KITCHEN - DAY Ree and Victoria enter kitchen.
Let’s keep it quiet. Teardrop’s still laying up in bed.  16. Ree takes off her coat and sits down at the table. Victor pours two cups of coffee.

The law came by today. Dad signed over everything to his bond. Victoria, I really gotta run Dad down to get him to show. Ree’s uncle, TEARDROP, 40’s, a worn, unshaven man enters. lights a cigarette and crosses the room.
You ought not do that. Don’t go running after Jessup. Teardrop sits at the table.
Show or don’t show that choice is up to the one going to jail, not you.
You know where he’s at, don’t you?
Where a man’s at ain’t necessarily for you to know neither.
But you do... Teardrop abruptly shoots a warning look at Ree.
I ain’t seen him. Victoria places a cup of coffee in front of him. Silence while Ree contemplates her next move.
Could be running around with Little Arthur and them, you think? Teardrop absentmindedly loads the magazine of a pistol.  17.
Don’t you ever go down around Little Arthur’s asking them people about shit they ain’t offering to talk about. That’s a real good way to end up et by hogs, or wishing you was.
We're all related ain’t we? Teardrop continues to fiddle with the pistol.
Our relations get watered kinda thin between here and Little Arthur's. Teardrop tosses the pistol onto the lazy susan in the mid of the table.
You know all those people, Teardrop. You could ask.
Shut up.
None of them’s gonna be in a great big hurry to tangle with you.
I said shut up once already with my mouth. Teardrop gets up and walks across the kitchen to the stov with his back to Ree.
Jesus, Dad’s your only brother. Teardrop spins back to face her.  18.

You think I forgot that? Hmm? Jessup and me run together for coming on forty years but I don’t know where he’s at, and I ain’t going to go around asking after him neither. Victoria tries to cut the tension by changing the subject
Ree, you still planning to join the army?
No, I don’t think I can any more. (to Teardrop) Listen... Teardrop lunges at Ree, grabs her hair and pulls her face back to look at him. He leans his face in very close to hers.

(shaking his head) No. He lets her go and exits the kitchen. Victoria locks eyes with Ree, then follows Teardrop. Ree, sitting at the table, can hear their muffled voices the next room. She rises and puts on her coat as they arg
She needs help.
Nope. Nope. listen. Listen! You tell that girl to stay close to home. Don’t move. Give her this. You send her ass on her way right now. Victoria comes back into the kitchen.  19.

Teardrop says you best keep your ass real close to the willows, dear. He hopes this helps. Victoria presses a wad of bills into Ree’s hand. She slip joint out of her cigarette package. VICTORIA (CONT’D) Here's a doobie for your walk. Ree takes the joint.
Thank you. Victoria stares at Ree as she leaves.
Ree hikes across a ruddy pasture strewn with dilapidated sheds.

Ree crosses the road and heads up a hill. EXT. MEGAN’S YARD - LATE AFTERNOON Ree enters a yard with laundry hanging on a line. A donke grazing on the other side of the fence. A half-eaten appl has rolled out of his reach. She picks it up and feeds it the donkey. MEGAN, 20, comes out onto the porch and calls out to Ree.
Hey! What’s your business here?
My dad’s, Jessup. He’s pals with Little Arthur, and I gotta find him. Megan stares Ree down, taking a long time to answer.

Hold on.  20. Megan goes inside the house. Ree takes in the details of yard. The wind strikes up, ominous clanking sounds surrou her. Megan comes back out with her coat on, approaches Ree, an guides her through the densely packed debris in the yard.
My name’s Megan, and I do know you, really. Seen you at some of the reunions. I knew Jessup when I seen him, too. Never did talk with him much.
You knew him?
Knew him when I seen him around, I mean. He does stuff I hear about.
He cooks crank.

They all do now. You don’t even need to say it out loud. INT. LITTLE ARTHUR’S HOUSE - AFTERNOON LITTLE ARTHUR, mid-30s, nervously looks out his window. EXT. LITTLE ARTHUR’S YARD - AFTERNOON Megan and Ree approach Little Arthur’s house.
If Arthur’s been runnin’ on crank for a day or two, you should just leave, okay? The door opens and Little Arthur smiles at Ree.
I knew it - I been in your dreams, ain’t I, little Ruthie?  21.
It’s Ree, you asshole. And I’m only out to find Dad.

Come on in, ladies. Ree pushes past Megan and enters the house. Megan follows INT. LITTLE ARTHUR’S HOUSE - AFTERNOON No fresh light makes its way through the windows. Little Arthur shows affection to his pet ferret, tapping on the glass of the tank. Ree and Megan hover near the door and watch him from the other side of the room.

This don’t gotta take long, man. I’m looking for Dad and thought maybe you’d been seeing him, maybe you two been getting into stuff together again. He turns away from the ferret and sits on the couch.
Not since the summer. At y’all’s place.
You ain’t seen him nowhere since then?
Huh-uh.
He kept leavin’ the house goin’ someplace- you don’t know where?
You got cat shit in your ear, girl?
I’ve got them two boys and Mom to tend, man. I need him.  22.
If I see the dude, I’11 tell him you said that. Little Arthur lights a cigarette, his hands shaking.
Your dad left you to do all that? That’s fucked up.
Well, he had to, the way things go, you know. Ree stares at Arthur. He lurches forward on the couch.
You want a line?
No.
You wanna blow some smoke?
No. Little Arthur slaps the table and stands up.
Then I guess I got nothing for you. He waves his hand to dismiss them.
Go on! Ree and Megan waste no time leaving. Arthur watches them
Megan and Ree walk up the road.
Don’t tell nobody it was me who told you this, okay? (MORE )
MEGAN (cont'd) But you’re going to have to go on up the hill and ask for a talk with Thump Milton. Now, I hope he’1l talk with you - he generally won't.
That man, scares me way more than the rest.

Well, scared ain’t a bad way to be about him, neither, hon. He’s my own granpaw, and I still make damn sure I never piss him off none. They continue walking until they reach Megan's property. EXT. MEGAN’S YARD - AFTERNOON
You go see Thump. Megan holds down a barbed wire fence to allow Ree to clim over it.
Go on. Ree heads up the hill while Megan watches her go.

Ree trudges through the woods. Dry leaves and branches crackle under her footsteps as she makes her way. EXT. THUMP MILTON’S YARD - AFTERNOON MERAB, 50’s, comes out to the porch of her house. Ree crosses the yard. Dogs herald her arrival with loud barki
You’ve got the wrong place, I expect. Who might you be?
I’m Ree. My Dad’s Jessup Dolly.  24. Merab gestures for Ree to come closer. Ree takes a few st towards the porch.
You ain’t here for trouble, are you?
No, ma’am.
Cause one of my nephews is Buster Leroy, and didn’t he shoot your daddy one time?
Yes'm, but that ain’t got nothing to do with me. They settled all that theirselves, I think.
Shooting him likely settled it. What is it you want?
I got a real bad need to talk with Thump.
And he ain’t got no need to talk to you. Merab turns away towards her doorway.
But I need to. I really, really got to ma’am. Please! Merab turns around to face Ree.
Some of our blood at least is the same. Ain’t that s’posed to mean something’ - isn’t that what is always said? Merab, irritated, moves to confront Ree.  25.
Ain’t you got no men could do this?
No, Ma’am, I don’t.
You go wait in the yard somewhere by that coop, and I’1l tell Thump you're here.

Thank you. Ree walks in the direction of the chicken coop. Merab goe inside. EXT. THUMP MILTON’S YARD - AFTERNOON Ree finds a place to sit next to the coop. The camera lingers on the various things Ree notices as s waits.
(to herself) Come on, already. EXT. THUMP MILTON’S YARD - LATE AFTERNOON Merab comes back outside carrying a mug and calls out to
He ain’t likely to have time for you, child.
I’ve got to talk to him. If he don’t know, nobody does.
Nope. Talking just causes witnesses. And he don’t want for any of those.
I'll wait.  26.
You need to get yourself on home. She gives Ree the mug.
Here, drink it down and be on your way. Ree drinks and hands the empty mug back to Merab.
Thanks.
Thump knows you were in the valley, child. With Megan. And at Little Arthur’s. He knows what you want to ask, and he don’t want to hear it.
And that’s it? He ain’t gonna say nothing to me?
If you’re listening, child, you got your answer. Merab turns her back and walks toward her house. Ree call after her.
So, I guess come the nut-cutting, blood don’t really mean shit to the big man. Am I understanding that right? Merab spins on her heel and gets up into Ree’s face.

Don’t you dare. Don’t! I want you to listen to me, child. You need to turn around, and get yourself on home. Merab turns and walks back to her house. As she reaches t doorstep, she turns back towards Ree.  27. MERAB (CONT’D) Don’t you make me come out here and tell you again! Merab enters the house and slams the door. As Ree stomps away, Merab eyes her suspiciously from the window. EXT. REE’S HOUSE - DAY Ashlee bounces on the trampoline on a toy horse. Ree comes out onto the porch.

Ashlee Dawn, come inside. Bring Brownie and Cupcake. Ashlee picks up the two horses and climbs off the trampol INT. REE’S HOUSE - DAY Ree is slicing potatoes into a sizzling pan. There is a loud knock at the door.
Ree, Get out here! EXT. REE’S HOUSE, PORCH - DAY Ree opens the door and steps out.
Do you know, there’s people going ‘round saying you best shut up. People you ought to listen to. Get your ass in the truck. He grabs Ree’s arm.
Don’t touch me.
Get your ass in the truck.  28. Blond Milton pushes Ree towards the truck. Ree grabs the porch beam to resist. Blond Milton shoves her down the stairs.
Get off!
Get in the truck! Sonny comes out of the house.
Hey!
D’ruther I hit you, boy?
Sonny, get back in the house. Cook them taters ‘til they’re brown then turn the stove off.
Don’t hurt my sister.
Sonny! Blond Milton turns around, climbs the porch steps and gra Sonny’s collar.
Having balls is good, boy, but don’t let ‘em get you hurt.
Sonny, get in the house!
(to Ree) Get your dumb ass in the truck.
I’m not getting in there with you.
Get in the truck. There’s something that you need to see.  29. Ree and Blond Milton get into the truck. INT. BLOND MILTON’S TRUCK - DAY (DRIVING)
Jessup and me may have had our tussles, but he was my cousin. It’s always a bad deal when these things blow.
Where are we going?
Down the road.
Down the road to where?
To someplace you need to see. Ree anxiously looks around trying to get her bearings.
They drive past woodlands until they reach a burned out house. Blond Milton pulls off the road and turns off the engine. INT. BLOND MILTON’S TRUCK - DAY (STATIONARY )
This right here is the last place me or anybody seen Jessup.
He never blew no lab before.
I know it. But something must have jumped wrong this time.
He’s known for never fucking up labs or cooking bad batches. He’s known for knowing what he’s doing.  30.
Well, you cook long enough, this is bound to happen.
You saying Dad’s up there burnt to a crisp?
That's what I’m saying.
I’m going’ up for a look. Ree opens her door and starts to exit the truck. Blond Mi grabs her arm.
No! That shit’s poison. It'll rip the skin off your bones!
If Dad’s up there, I’m bringing him home to bury.
Ree! Ree wrests herself free and gets out of the truck, slammi the door behind her. Blond watches as she approaches the ruined house.

Ree walks across the road to the burned out house. She cautiously approaches the house, looking at the detai of the wreckage. One wall is blown out to the yard, windo have exploded and the blackened wall fragments and insula dangle from the broken studs. She takes in a melted stove and notes weeds growing throu the floorboards. INT. BLOND MILTON’S TRUCK - DAY (DRIVING) Ree and Blond Milton drive home silently. Ree looks out t window, lost in thought, weighing her options.  31. EXT. BLOND MILTON’S HOUSE - DAY Blond Milton and Ree get out of the truck in front of his house. He stops Ree as she starts to walk home across the holler. Ree walks
I know losing Jessup leaves you all hurting over there. I know it’s a lot to handle.
We'll make do.
Sonya and me talked about it. We feel we could take Sonny off your hands. Not Ashlee, I don’t reckon, but we could take Sonny.
You what?
We could take him and raise him up the rest of the way.
My ass, you will.
We'd raise the boy way better’n you and that nut job mama of yours can. Maybe on down the line we'd take Ashlee, too.
You go straight to hell, you son of a bitch. Sonny and Ashlee will die living in a cave with me and Mama before they spend one night with you. away, then turns back to Blond Milton.
Goddamn you! You must think I'ma stupid idiot. (MORE )

There’s weeds growing chin high in that place. It must have been a year since that place blew! Ree spits at Blond Milton’s feet. He turns and leaves. Re angrily marches back across the holler to her house. EXT. REE’S YARD - DAY Sonny and Ashlee place plastic bottles on a picnic table, then run back to where Ree is waiting. Ree props up a double-barrelled shotgun for Sonny and Ash to examine.

Come here, look at this. Ash, quit playing around, c’mere. This trigger shoots this barrel, this trigger shoots this barrel. Now there’s hardly ever gonna be a time where you need both. But if you gotta kill something big and mean, then you use both. Ree puts the double-barreled gun on the ground and picks the other shotgun that’s lying there.

Now this gun is what you’ll use when you’re older. But this one is the gun I learned on. This is Daddy’s squirrel gun. Now the most important thing is do not put your finger on the trigger unless you're ready to shoot, you’re aimed at your target. And don’t ever-- both of you look at me-- never point this at each other, not ever. Alright? Kneel down like you’re praying. Yeah, just like that. Yup. Sonny picks up the gun and rests it on his shoulder. Ree stands over him instructing him.
You see that cross? It’s called the crosshairs. Aim that up at the middle of your target. And when that’s lined up in the middle then you squeeze the trigger and you shoot. Sonny shoots.
Okay.
Ree!
Hang on. (to Gail) Hey! (to Sonny and Ashlee) Both of you sit on your hands. Don’t touch it. Gail enters with her baby in a baby carrier.
Hey! Hey!
Damn, Sweet Pea. What’s with all the guns?
Just teaching them a little bit of survival. Ree takes a peek at Ned in the carrier.
(to Ned) Hi! 33. Ree hugs her.  34. INT. REE’S HOUSE - DAY Ree and Gail are standing at the kitchen counter. Ned is the counter inside the carrier. Gail tosses a set of keys up onto the counter.
Got the truck off him.

You are who I always did think you were, Darlin’. You truly are. EXT. REE’S YARD - NIGHT Gail and Ree come out of Ree’s house. Gail carries Ned in carrier. They open the doors of Floyd’s truck and secure carrier in place.
Turn it this way.
Backwards?
Yup. Does your mom know what’s going on?
I’m not sure.
You think you should tell her?
This is the exact shit she went crazy trying to get away from. It'd be too mean to tell her.
I guess she couldn’t help, anyhow.

Nope. They climb into the truck and drive away.  35. INT. APRIL’S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM - NIGHT A picking session is in process. MARIDETH, APRIL’s mother sings, accompanied by her friends playing music. April si on the couch watching. In another part of the room, two couples play cards.

(sings) As I look on that valley far below. It’s green as far as I can see. As my memories return, oh how my heart does yearn For you and the days that used to be. High on a mountain, wind blowing free, I wonder if you still remember me. Marideth turns to her friends.
Play it through. Ree and Gail (with baby carrier) knock at the door. April gets up to answer their knock.

(sings) I wonder if you still remember me Or has time erased your memory? As I listen to the breeze whisper gently through the trees, I wonder if you still remember me. April opens the door and hesitates before greeting Ree.
(sings) Come all ye fair and tender ladies, Take a warning how you court your men.
Come on in.  36. She motions Ree and Gail in. They step inside quietly and survey the scene, checking to see if they know anyone. APRIL (CONT’D) It’s Ma’s birthday.
Happy birthday.
You want anything? Something to drink, food?
I’m here huntin’ Dad.
I was guessin’ that. Come on in. April leads Ree and Gail through the living room to her daughter’s bedroom.

(sings) They're like a star on a a summer morning They first appear and then they’re gone. I wish I was a little sparrow And I had wings and I could fly. I'd fly straight away... INT. APRIL’S HOUSE - BEDROOM - NIGHT In the cramped kids room, Gail and Ree pay close attentio April.
You know me’n Jessup quit keepin’ company a good while ago.
I figured. I thought you might still know a thing or two.  37.
Well, I’m kind of afraid I might. I wish I could kick back for this one, Ree. April sits down next to them.
You still bad on the bottle?

No, no, I give that up. A couple months ago Jessup and me run across each other by total accident. He got me to laughing so, things rekindled for a day or two. Then he was gone again. Then about, maybe, three or four weeks back, I'd stopped at Cruikshank’s, he was in there with three fellas I didn’t know, and they didn’t look to be having no fun, either.
Dad say anything?

He looked square at me, but acted like he didn’t know me, like he'd never seen me before. Something real wrong was going on. Ree is lost in her thoughts trying to take this in. April tries to look her in the eye.
I’m sorry.
Ree, Sonny and Ashlee sit silently with their back agains large oak. Ree holds a shotgun propped and ready to fire.
If you stay really still and quiet, they’11 come out. Sonny sneezes.  38.
Bless you.
How long do we have to wait for a squirrel?
A long time, usually.
Wish we could get deer.
It’s not time for deer.
When is it?
In the morning or at night. You know that.
(whispers to Ree) Do you see one?
